thread.title: Tickled pink: Pakistani women hold 'rickshaw rally' for equality
thread.title_full: Tickled pink: Pakistani women hold 'rickshaw rally' for equality | News24

author: news24.com
title: Tickled pink: Pakistani women hold 'rickshaw rally' for equality
text:
Lahore - The streets of the Pakistani city of Lahore were tickled pink on Saturday, when a group of women staged a rose-coloured "rickshaw rally" for female empowerment.
Driven by female representatives from local social groups and charities, the bright pink, covered three-wheeled motorcycles zipped through the city in a bid to highlight the challenges faced by Pakistani women.
The project is the brain child of Zar Aslam, president of non-profit Environment Protection Fund (EPF), who launched the service exclusively for women after years of being harassed by male rickshaw drivers.
"We started this Pink Rickshaw initiative to empower women," she told AFP after leading the rally from an upmarket residential complex to the city's main Quaid-e-Azam library.
